alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 5:39AM PST until January 13 at 11:40AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Satsop River Near Satsop affecting Grays Harbor County. .The river will gradually recede. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding continues this morning. * WHERE...Satsop River Near Satsop. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 38.0 feet, the Satsop River will flood low pasture lands and some roads along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM PST Thursday the stage was 37.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will slowly recede, and is expected to fall to 32.4 feet early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 38.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 37.3 feet on 12/20/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 1145 AM PST.
